key_points: Federal prosecutors decided not to charge the Capitol Police officer who shot Air Force veteran Ashli Babbitt during the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.
The shooting occurred as Babbitt was climbing through a broken door during the insurrection.
Ashli Babbitt, a 35-year-old from San Diego, died from the shooting.
The investigation included reviewing video footage, statements from involved and witnessing officers, physical evidence, and autopsy results.
Authorities concluded there was insufficient evidence for a criminal prosecution.
Video evidence shows Babbitt attempting to climb through a door before being shot.
Babbitt was part of the mob trying to enter the House chamber while officers evacuated Congress members.
The officer fired a single shot, hitting Babbitt in the shoulder.
Babbitt died at a hospital after receiving first aid from a police tactical team.
The difficulty of prosecuting police shootings and the circumstances of the day were factors in the decision not to charge.
